title: Ali Khamenei
summary: Sayyid Ali Hosseini Khamenei[6] (Persian: سید علی حسینی خامنه‌ای‎, pronounced [ʔæˈliː hosejˈniː xɒːmeneˈʔiː] (listen); born 19 April 1939)[14][15] is a Twelver Shia Marja' and the second and current supreme leader of Iran, in office since 1989.[16][17] He was previously the third president of Iran from 1981 to 1989. Khamenei is the longest serving head of state in the Middle East, as well as the second-longest serving Iranian leader of the last century, after Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi.[18]
